Brookville ''Songs of Sinatra,'' presented by Steve Tyrell. Jan. 20 at 8 p.m. $37 to $65. Oceanside Good Vibrations, Len Hirsch, guitar, and Tom Rizzuto, vibraphone. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. Free; tickets required. Oceanside Library, 30 Davison Avenue. (516) 766-2360.

Oyster Bay Works by Haydn, Mozart and Brahms, performed by the Calder String Quartet. Jan. 14 at 2:30 p.m. $35. Coe Hall, Planting Fields Arboretum State Historic Park, 1395 Planting Fields Road. (516) 922-9200.

Patchogue Patchogue Jam: Miles to Dayton, The Kelly Project, Movement and others, rock. Jan. 20 at 7 p.m. $20. Janaki String Quartet, chamber music. Jan. 21 at 3 p.m. $15; seniors and students, $12. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.

Roslyn ''Isadora and the American Jewish Experience,'' original dances by Isadora Duncan interspersed with reflections on her work presented by Dance Visions. Jan. 14 at 2:30 p.m. Free. Bryant Library, 2 Paper Mill Road. (516) 621-2240.

Stony Brook Garland Jeffreys, singer and songwriter. Jan. 14 at 2 p.m. $20 to $25. Ellis Paul with Antje Duvekot, folk. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. $25; students, $20. University Cafe, Stony Brook Union Building, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-6027.

Bohemia ''Godspell'' by Stephen Schwartz and John-Michael Tebelak. Through Jan. 28. $14 to $20. Airport Playhouse, 218 Knickerbocker Avenue. (631) 589-7588.

East Farmingdale ''Happy Birthday Bridgit,'' comedy by Marc Camoletti. Through Feb. 4. $18 to $22. ''How the Other Half Loves,'' by Alan Ayckbourn. Through Jan. 21. $16 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.

Quogue Edward Albee's ''Everything in the Garden,'' presented by the Hampton Theater Company, directed by Sarah Hunnewell. Through Jan. 28. $10 to $20. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
Comedy
Bay Shore Joe Piscopo, comedian and musician. Friday at 7 and 9:30 p.m. $45. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.
Bridgehampton Just Say Yes, improvisational comedy group. Jan. 20 at 9 p.m. $12 and two-drink minimum. Alison Restaurant, 95 School Street. (631) 537-7100.
Film

East Hampton Winter Film Series: ''Familia,'' directed by Louise Archambault. Jan. 14 at 7 p.m. ''Hawaii Oslo,'' directed by Erik Poppe; in Norwegian with English subtitles. Jan. 21 at 7 p.m. Free. Guild Hall, 158 Main Street. (631) 324-4050.

Sag Harbor The Picture Show: ''Mrs. Miniver,'' directed by William Wyler. Friday at 8 p.m. ''Casablanca,'' directed by Michael Curtiz. Jan. 20 at 8 p.m. Both $5. Bay Street Theater, Main and Bay Streets. (631) 725-9500.

Westhampton Beach ''Cave of the Yellow Dog,'' directed by Byambasuren Davaa; in Mongolian with English subtitles. Jan. 14 at 1 and 4 p.m. ''For Your Consideration,'' directed by Christopher Guest. Friday and Jan. 20 at 7:30 p.m.; Jan. 21 at 1 and 4 p.m. $3 to $10. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
Outdoors

Calverton ''Wildlife Rescue Volunteer Training,'' learn to handle and clean birds after oil spills. Jan. 20 from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Free; reservations required. Miller Environmental Group's Learning Center, 538 Edwards Avenue. (631) 727-7850.

East Norwich ''Special Places at Muttontown,'' guided hike to sites on the preserve, like Succession Field and the Hidden Pond. Jan. 21 at 10 a.m. Muttontown Preserve, Muttontown Lane. (516) 571-8500.
Huntington ''Winter Seasonal Stroll,'' relaxed adult nature hike. Jan. 14 at 1 p.m. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.
Long Beach ''Winter Sky Watch,'' indoor instruction followed by outdoor observation. Friday at 7 p.m. $3; reservations required. Theodore Roosevelt Nature Center, Ocean Parkway. (516) 679-7254.

Wednesday at 7 p.m. Jim Ryan, ''Simple Happiness: 52 Ways to Lighten Up.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.
Plainview Barbara Reiher-Meyers, poet. Jan. 21 at 7 p.m. Free. Mid-Island Y Jewish Community Center, 45 Manetto Hill Road. (516) 822-3535.

Sagaponack Charlotte Frieze, author of ''The Zone Garden'' and garden editor of House and Garden magazine. Jan. 21 at 11 a.m. $45; members, $35. Madoo Conservancy, 618 Sagg Main Street. (631) 537-8200.
St. James Deborah Ann Hurley, author of ''Fragments of Hope.'' Jan. 20 at 6 p.m. Free. Mills Pond House, 660 Route 25A. (631) 862-6575.
For Children

Garden City ''Martin Luther King: I Have a Dream Workshop.'' Learn about Dr. King and create a mobile. Jan. 14 and Monday at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. $3 with museum admission. ''It's a Beautiful Thing,'' a film about hip-hop, produced and presented by the Hip Hop Kidz. Ages 7 and up. Monday at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. Kids First! Film Club: ''Tillamook Treasure,'' directed by Jane Beaumont Hall. Ages 8 to 14. Friday at 6:30 p.m. $5; members, $3. ''Passion and Fire,'' family classical music concert presented by Chamber Players International. Ages 4 and up. Jan. 20 and 21 at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Glen Cove ''Oratorio Terezin'' by Ruth Fazel, a musical about the Terezin Ghetto and an introduction to the Holocaust for children ages 6 to 12 and their families. Jan. 21 at 1:30 p.m. Free; reservations recommended. Holocaust Memorial and Tolerance Center, 100 Crescent Beach Road. (516) 571-8040.

Islip ''Peter Pan and Wendy,'' presented by Broadhollow Theater; followed by a princess tea party. Through Feb. 3. $8; $20 for show and tea party. Registration required. BayWay Arts Center, 265 East Main Street. (631) 581-2700.
Long Beach ''Giants of the Sea''; explore marine mammals through activities and crafts. Ages 5 and up. Jan. 20 at 10:30 a.m. Theodore Roosevelt Nature Center, Ocean Parkway. (516) 679-7254.

Oakdale ''Deer Detectives,'' search for deer by following clues they leave behind. Ages 5 and up. Jan. 20 at 1:30 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.
Port Washington Jeff Sorg and the Songs Say So Much Band. Jan. 20 at 4:30 p.m. $5; children under 1, free. Parent Resource Center, Landmark Gym, 232 Main Street, Suite 4. (516) 767-3808.

Riverhead ''Snowflakes''; learn how snowflakes are formed and create crystal crafts. Jan. 14, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. ''Science Fair Fun,'' ideas and instructions for sample science fair projects. Jan. 21, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Both: $2; children, $5. Long Island Science Center, 11 West Main Street. (631) 208-8000.

Westhampton Beach ''Swimmy, Frederick and Inch by Inch'' by Leo Lionni, presented by the Mermaid Theater of Nova Scotia. Friday at 10 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. $8. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
Museums and Galleries

Cold Spring Harbor ''What If? Long Island That Might Have Been,'' exhibition featuring unrealized design plans for Long Island. Through Jan. 28. $1. Hours: Daily, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Society for the Preservation of Long Island Antiquities, 1 Shore Road. (631) 692-4664.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through August. $4; seniors and students, $3; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.

East Islip ''Animal House,'' works by various artists who portray animals to comment on contemporary society. Through Jan. 28. Donation: $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Huntington ''East Coast/West Coast and Beyond: Colin Campbell Cooper, American Impressionist.'' Through Jan. 28. $5; seniors, $3; children ages 5 to 12, $1; under 5, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays, 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 8:30 p.m. Heckscher Museum of Art, 2 Prime Avenue. (631) 351-3250.

Oakdale ''Inventory Control,'' multimedia works by Elise Engler, Chris Bors and others. Jan. 14 through Feb. 25. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Anthony Giordano Gallery, Dowling College, Idle Hour Boulevard. (631) 244-3016.

Riverhead ''Creatures +,'' works by Edward Batcheller, Claudia Hart, John Levien and Robert Strimban. Through Jan. 14. ''Art in Clay,'' works by competition finalists. Through Jan. 14. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Art Sites, 651 West Main Street. (631) 323-1426.

Riverhead ''Ice Age: Revisited,'' exhibition featuring animals that lived during the Ice Age. Thursday through March 18. $11; $9, 62+ and 12-18; $8, 3-11; free, 2 and under. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.
Riverhead Caroline M. Bell and the Peconic Impressionists. Through April 30. Suffolk County Historical Society, 300 West Main Street. (631) 727-2881.

Roslyn Harbor ''Picasso and the School of Paris,'' works by Picasso and others who lived in Paris from the 1920s to 1950s. Through Feb. 4. ''Chuck Close,'' photographic works. Through Feb. 4. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Stony Brook ''Painters for a New America,'' works by William Sidney Mount and Shepard Alonzo Mount. Through Feb. 18. $7; seniors, $6; students, $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.
